intro: Tetranthera umbrosa, commonly known as the shadowy tetranthera, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in cymes, and its fruits are small, three-lobed capsules. Tetranthera umbrosa thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
